document.masterDocTitle: A review of Chelonian type specimens (order Testudines)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Chelonian type specimens (order Testudines)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntypes
(3;
Fritz et al. 1994:171
): ZMB 38 and 39 (extant) and
ZMB 37 (lost)
;
ZMB 38 designated lectotype by Stuckas & Fritz (2011:336–37 ,
and photographed and sampled genetically therein). The type of
Testudo rostrata ( Thunberg, 1787:179 )
in the UPSZTY (= UUZM ) 128) is not
Amyda cartilaginea
as usually recorded (e.g., Wermuth & Mertens, 1977:107 ), but rather
Pelodiscus sinensis
( Webb 1985:84 ; see also Deraniyagala 1961 ). The International Commission on Zoological Nomenclature was petitioned (Case 2693; Webb, 1990 ) to suppress the earlier name and conserve Wiegmann’s name; conservation of the latter was mandated by ICZN Opinion 1659 (in 1991).

bibRefCitation.author: Thunberg, C. P.
bibRefCitation.refString: Thunberg, C. P. (1787) Beskrifning pa trenne skold-paddor. [Descriptionofthreeturtles]. KongligaVetenskapsAcademiens Nya Handlingar, Stockholm, (2) 8, 178 - 180. [in Swedish]

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
UPSZTY 128 (formerly UUZM 128 and UUZM 2); Thunberg (1828:49) , Lönnberg (1896) , Webb (1985 , 1990 ), and Wallin (2001) . See comment under
Pelodiscus sinensis
.

Syntypes
(number uncertain): only two locatable;
RMNH 3259 and 3264 (
Hoogmoed et al. 2010:22
; illustrated in the original description; Pl. VII, Figs. 1–2, and Pl. V , Fig. 7)
;
RMNH 3264 photographed in
Hoogmoed et al. (2010:22)
.

.
